ygData.subject: CVS Compilation issued with Visual Studio .NET 2005
ygData.msgSnippet: The current CVS version isn t compiling properly on VS .NET 2005 out of the box, the compiler complains about errors in the utilities.h

The current CVS version isn't compiling properly on VS .NET 2005 out of the 
box, the compiler complains about errors in the utilities.h
c:\cantera\include\cantera\kernel\utilities.h(91) : error C2059: syntax 
error : ')'.
I asked a fellow c++ wiz and he suggested to remove all the leading 
underscores in the variable names and that did the trick.
Example: ++__begin does not work, but ++begin does.

As far as I know, using leading underscores in variable names is generally 
not recommended.


Regards,
Haldir
